text:
I'm cross-listing this little item here under the suggestion of the wonderful <@UD53A9UUR>:

"It would be wonderful if that scrollbar had a bit more height to it. It disappears from a click area quite rapidly with a scaled display. This has become exceptionally irritating for me when I'm trying to navigate to have the individual tabs be in view as opposed to simply going to the file in the view panel."
not sure what the duck means
but i like it
Let's run with it.
done and done

I posted in the other thread but, I wholeheartedly agree on the height of the bar. however I’ve actually tried to address this in the past. it’s just more of a pain than you’d expect, due to how the scrollbar actually works, doing it the right way will require adjusting several elements.

This month I don’t forsee myself having the time to make the change. if you are interested in making it yourself I can point you in the right direction, and your contribution will be credited.

I can add it to the list of issues for now though if I don’t already have an item

<@U7SL518D6> Thanks for providing that bit of insight on the challenges of accomplishing this:

>regarding the height of the tab bar - I personally agree - however it’s actually more challenging than you’d think. in order to do that they will have to adjust a lot of other elements unfortunately. because the selectable region of the bar is limited. and that’s the real problem.
Well, heck... sure why not. I might as well start messing around with this little crew with their shenanigans. Point me to the correct area and I'll start futzing.
huzzah!

That would be lovely -- though I'm probably going to be quite cautious about dumping anything. I've avoided participating actively in dev groups as I'm afraid of messing up code repos -- so if I find a working solution for this, I'll probably be in close contact with you for actually getting it up and live as to not create code conflict issues elsewhere.

<@UDFTHC6PK> This is the file you’ll want to edit <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/blob/master/hsDarkIde.css>

This css file gets loaded in the design manager just like a normal stylesheet.

Under UI Tweaks(which is near the top)

is where I would suggest adding your css to make this change.  don’t be afraid of using an !important
and just start your css selectors with
`html.ext-ui-tweaks`

The class ext-ui-tweaks is added to the html element if the user has enabled UI tweaks in the extension
basically you write your css just like you would anywhere else, inspect the element get it’s selector add some styles.
beautiful. thanks <@U7SL518D6>

and don’t worry too much about making a mistake or not following proper procedure or something when contributing. We’re a little bit lax, and kinda have a philosophy of build it sloppy first, make it pretty later.

As long as your code works and it’s somewhat easy to tell what it’s doing. Then :thumbsup:. Most of this community is still learning git and github. So we’d rather not impose too many rules and whatnot as it scares off new-to-git people who might want to make some contributions.
yer a peach
“not following proper procedure” refers to me :slightly_smiling_face:
nah, you did just fine
“We’re a little bit lax”  refers to Jon’s response to me
:stuck_out_tongue:
hey don’t worry about it. When :will: showed me the repo he made for the extension, I got in there along with <@U7ADCU3BM> and we messed it up so bad it’s got 450+ users.
Ha!
bahahha
welp -- that's back wtih you <@U7SL518D6>
...I did a happy dance of trying to get that running in my own dev land and fell into the login loop of doom. Local edits on github it is...

<@UDFTHC6PK> had a clever idea to make that bar more easy to click on - changing the cursor so you can more easily see you’re over it. it’s set to be the move cursor, just feel like maybe that might feel strange from a UX perspective but I could be completely wrong. I don’t really know that I have a better idea though.
I would leave it default arrow as it could cause confusion on users using something else that has a different meaning (like move or resize)
feel like windows used to have a scrollbar cursor. :confused:
i mean windows used to do a lot of things lol...
RIP Microsoft Bob
lol you’re right
but a subtle cursor change for scrollbars seems like not a bad idea. keyword subtle
Could put a hover on the cursor shuttle
Not-allowed or wait
Diabolical
lol
I’ll just stick cursor:wait; on everything in the design manager. Perpetual beachball of doom feeling for mac users
Bahaha - yeah I bounced up and down the list of options several times before the hands were thrown in the air.
The only reason I stayed from the standard pointer was due to the lack of differentiation between being on the tabs and directly over the scroll bar itself
